intro: Commersonia aspera, commonly known as the rough commersonia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in full sun and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and minimal water.
